sect2.title: Installation of Lynx
sect2.para: Install Lynx by running the following commands:

userinput.command: ./configure --prefix=/usr --libdir=/etc \ --with-zlib --with-bzlib && make && make install && make docdir=/usr/share/doc/lynx-&lynx-version;/lynx_doc \ helpdir=/usr/share/doc/lynx-&lynx-version;/lynx_help install-doc && make docdir=/usr/share/doc/lynx-&lynx-version;/lynx_doc \ helpdir=/usr/share/doc/lynx-&lynx-version;/lynx_help install-help && chgrp -R root /usr/share/doc/lynx-&lynx-version;/lynx_doc

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --libdir=/etc: For some reason, the configure and make routine for Lynx uses libdir as the prefix for the configuration file. This is set to /etc so that the system wide configuration file is /etc/lynx.cfg.
--with-zlib: This enables support for linking libz into Lynx.
--with-bzlib: This enables support for linking libbz2 into Lynx.
docdir=... helpdir=...: These variables are set to avoid getting the help and documentation files installed under /etc.
--with-ssl: This enables support for linking SSL into Lynx.
--with-gnutls: This enables support for linking GnuTLS into Lynx.
chgrp -R root /usr/share/doc/lynx/2.8.5/lynx_doc: This command corrects the improper group ownership of installed documentation files caused if Lynx is built by any user other than root.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Various settings such as proxies can be set in the system-wide lynx.cfg file found in /etc.

sect3.title: lynx
sect3.para: lynx is a general purpose, text-based, distributed information browser for the World Wide Web.
